hero.title: Media Ministry Documentation
hero.subtitle: Excellence in Worship Technology
hero.description: Creating detailed process documentation ensures consistency, simplifies training for volunteers, and minimizes errors during services. Your comprehensive guide to church media operations.

sections.title: General SOP Document Details
sections.content: Every Standard Operating Procedure should contain essential metadata for tracking and accountability.

items.title: SOP Title
items.content: Weekend Service: Live Stream Operation

items.title: Process Owner
items.content: Media Director/Tech Lead

items.title: Current Revision
items.content: Version 2.1 - Updated October 2025

items.title: Applicable Roles
items.content: Live Stream Operator, Camera Operator, A/V Technician

items.title: Goal/Objective
items.content: To broadcast a clear, high-quality, and reliable video and audio feed of the service to our online platforms (YouTube, Facebook).

sections.title: Pre-Service Setup Procedures
sections.content: Critical preparation steps that must be completed before service begins.

items.title: Power Up & Check Gear (90 min before)
items.content: Turn on all computers, A/V switcher, cameras, and network bridge. Log into streaming platform accounts. Verify all equipment status lights are green.

items.title: A/V System Test (60 min before)
items.content: Check audio board: Run pink noise to verify main mix and stream mix levels. Confirm all stage mics are active and properly labeled.

items.title: Video Camera Setup (45 min before)
items.content: Turn on cameras. Calibrate white balance/iris. Confirm all cameras are feeding correctly into the video switcher.

items.title: Presentation Prep (30 min before)
items.content: Load all sermon graphics, announcements slides, and song lyrics into presentation software. Run through service rundown cue-by-cue.

sections.title: Live Service Operations
sections.content: Real-time operations during the worship service.

items.title: Start Live Stream (5 min before)
items.content: Click 'Go Live' on the streaming software and verify the stream is active on all platforms. Announce to the team: 'Stream is Live.'

items.title: Manage Audio Mix (Continuous)
items.content: During Worship: Balance instrument and vocal volumes. During Preaching: Ensure pastor's voice is clear and consistent. Monitor the stream mix separately!

items.title: Video Switching (Continuous)
items.content: Follow the Shot List/Director's cues. Use a variety of close-ups (IMAG) and wide shots. Avoid rapid-fire cuts.

items.title: Manage Graphics/Lyrics (As needed)
items.content: Display lyrics in time with the music. Transition sermon points as the speaker moves on.

sections.title: Post-Service Procedures
sections.content: Essential cleanup and archiving tasks after service completion.

items.title: End Stream & Recording (Immediately after)
items.content: Click 'End Stream' on the software. Verify that the recorded file is saved to the designated server/drive.

items.title: Power Down Gear (Within 20 min)
items.content: Turn off all non-essential equipment (cameras, projectors, stage lights, computers). Leave the soundboard on standby unless otherwise directed.

items.title: Media Archiving (Within 24 hours)
items.content: Upload the recorded service (audio and video) to the cloud and a secondary local backup. Begin post-production for VOD (Video on Demand).

items.title: Audio Equipment
items.description: Soundboard/Mixer, Microphones, In-Ear Monitors, Audio Processing

items.title: Video Equipment
items.description: Cameras, Video Switcher, Projectors, Screens, Lighting

items.title: Software Systems
items.description: Presentation Software, Streaming Software, Recording Systems

items.title: Network & Streaming
items.description: Internet Connection, Streaming PC, Backup Systems, Monitoring

cards.title: Emergency Protocols
cards.content: Quick reference guide for handling technical failures during live services. Know what to do when audio fails, stream goes down, or equipment malfunctions.

cards.title: Media Request Workflow
cards.content: Step-by-step process for other ministries to request media services. From initial request to final delivery and archiving.

cards.title: Training & Onboarding
cards.content: Comprehensive checklist ensuring every new volunteer receives consistent training and certification for independent operation.

items.title: Audio Feed Failure
items.content: Switch to backup feed ‚Üí Use handheld mic ‚Üí Check connections

items.title: Stream Goes Down
items.content: Check internet ‚Üí Restart streaming software ‚Üí Switch to backup platform

items.title: Projector Screen Black
items.content: Check HDMI connections ‚Üí Toggle input source ‚Üí Use backup monitor

items.title: Pastor's Mic Failure
items.content: Hand backup handheld mic ‚Üí Mute original channel ‚Üí Use podium mic if available

items.title: Request Submission
items.content: Ministry submits formal Media Request Form (3 weeks minimum notice)

items.title: Review & Planning
items.content: Media Director reviews and determines resource needs (2 business days)

items.title: Production Phase
items.content: Content creation, filming, editing (2 weeks to draft completion)

items.title: Approval Process
items.content: Ministry leader and executive team review (1 week before launch)

items.title: Delivery & Publication
items.content: Final delivery via cloud drive and scheduled publication

items.title: Archiving
items.content: Move to completed projects folder (within 3 days)

items.title: Orientation
items.content: Review Media Team Vision, Mission, and Confidentiality Policies

items.title: Technical Training
items.content: System power procedures, presentation software, hands-on practice

items.title: Shadowing Period
items.content: Must shadow current operator for 3 services minimum

items.title: Emergency Protocols
items.content: Master troubleshooting procedures and emergency responses

items.title: Independent Operation
items.content: Solo operation with mentor nearby for 1 service

items.title: Final Certification
items.content: Media Director sign-off for independent service operation

additionalSections.title: The '5 W's' of Process Documentation
additionalSections.content: When documenting any task, make sure you answer these questions for every step:

items.title: WHAT
items.content: What is the specific task? (e.g., Start the live stream)

items.title: WHO
items.content: Who is responsible? (e.g., Live Stream Operator)

items.title: WHEN
items.content: When does it happen? (e.g., 5 minutes before service)

items.title: WHERE
items.content: Where is the equipment? (e.g., Streaming PC in Control Desk)

items.title: WHY
items.content: Why are we doing it? (e.g., To ensure online congregation can participate)
